D1.label: Office Market Recovery
D1.description: Australian office market recovery drives occupancy, rents, and asset revaluations higher
D1.plain_english: The worst of the Australian office downturn is over. CBD net absorption is turning positive, vacancy rates are stabilising, and Dexus's premium office portfolio in Sydney and Melbourne is well-positioned to capture the recovery. If cap rates compress and rents grow, NTA per unit will recover and close the gap with the current share price.
D1.what_to_watch: H1 FY26 results (18 February 2026): office occupancy, like-for-like income growth, and cap rate movements. Positive net absorption across CBDs would confirm the recovery thesis.
D1.upside: If office cap rates compress 25-50bps and rents grow 3-5%, Dexus NTA could recover meaningfully, driving a share price re-rating.
D1.risk_plain: If return-to-office trends stall or reverse, and sublease supply increases, the office recovery could take much longer than expected.

D2.label: Steady-State REIT
D2.description: Steady-state REIT: stable distributions, gradual portfolio repositioning toward industrial and alternatives
D2.plain_english: Dexus continues its strategic pivot from pure office toward a diversified real assets platform. Industrial development delivers strong returns, funds management fees grow steadily, and distributions remain well-covered. The stock trades at a discount to NTA but reflects the market's fair assessment of the office headwinds.
D2.what_to_watch: FY26 distribution guidance and AFFO per security. If AFFO holds above 45 cents and distributions are maintained, the base case holds.
D2.risk_plain: If office valuations continue to decline, the NTA discount persists and distributions may come under pressure.

D3.label: Structural Office Decline
D3.description: Structural office decline: hybrid work permanently reduces CBD office demand; asset values fall further
D3.plain_english: The shift to hybrid work is permanent and accelerating. Companies continue to reduce their office footprint, sublease space floods the market, and CBD vacancy rates stay elevated. Dexus's office-heavy portfolio suffers ongoing valuation writedowns, and the NTA discount to share price persists or widens.
D3.what_to_watch: CBD vacancy rates (PCA data), tenant lease expiry profiles, and any major tenant downsizing announcements. Rising sublease availability is the clearest negative signal.
D3.risk_plain: If office valuations decline another 10-15%, Dexus may need to cut distributions to preserve capital and manage gearing.

D4.label: Interest Rate & Refinancing Risk
D4.description: Higher-for-longer interest rates compress REIT valuations; rising cost of debt erodes earnings
D4.plain_english: If interest rates stay higher for longer than the market expects, REIT valuations face a double hit: higher discount rates compress asset values, and higher debt costs eat into distributable earnings. Dexus, with significant debt facilities, is exposed to refinancing risk at higher rates.
D4.what_to_watch: RBA cash rate trajectory and bond yields. If the 10-year government bond yield rises above 5%, REIT valuations face further pressure.
D4.risk_plain: Each 50bps increase in borrowing costs reduces Dexus AFFO by approximately 2-3 cents per security.

big_picture: Dexus is Australia's largest listed office REIT and a leading integrated real asset manager with $50.1 billion in assets under management. The company owns, manages, and develops premium office, industrial, and alternative assets primarily in Australian CBDs.

last_flip.trigger: FY25 results delivered on AFFO guidance; office occupancy stabilising; positive net absorption in Sydney CBD

narrative_history.trigger: H1 FY25 office valuations declined; CBD vacancy remained elevated; hybrid work impact deepening

evidence_items.summary: FY25 AFFO 45.0 cents per security; delivered on guidance; distribution 37.0 cents
Positive net absorption across all four major Australian CBDs; Sydney CBD vacancy declining from peak
190,400 sqm industrial construction across 10 projects; 6 fully leased pre-completion
Funds management platform grown to $50.1B AUM; fee income diversifying earnings away from direct property
